exam.summary: Two Federation allies claim the same dilithium-rich moon, and both demand your arbitration.

answers.text: Facilitate a joint resource agreement and insist on scientific verification of both claims before settlement.
answers.details: Balances equity with fact-finding, reinforcing Federation values of cooperation and evidence-based resolution.

answers.text: Award the moon to the technologically weaker ally to maintain balance of power.
answers.details: Shows strategic compassion but risks setting precedent for political favoritism.

answers.text: Avoid involvement and declare the matter outside Federation jurisdiction.
answers.details: Evading responsibility undermines diplomatic credibility and trust.

exam.summary: During a treaty dinner, your science officer accidentally violates a sacred custom of the host species.

answers.text: Offer a sincere apology and allow the offended delegation to dictate an appropriate form of restitution.
answers.details: Acknowledges accountability while showing humility—core Federation diplomatic practice.

answers.text: Defend your officer publicly, arguing that intent should outweigh misunderstanding.
answers.details: Demonstrates loyalty but risks deepening cultural insult.

answers.text: Ignore the incident to avoid drawing attention.
answers.details: Dismissal of the offense signals arrogance and damages relations.

exam.summary: Pirates seize a Federation freighter crew. The local government forbids any Starfleet intervention.

answers.text: Open back-channel discussions with the local government while covertly preparing a humanitarian rescue option.
answers.details: Demonstrates balance between political respect and moral obligation.

answers.text: Threaten economic sanctions unless the hostages are released immediately.
answers.details: Can yield results but risks long-term resentment and instability.

answers.text: Authorize armed extraction without notifying the government.
answers.details: Violates sovereignty and diplomatic protocol, endangering future negotiations.

exam.summary: Negotiations between two rival species collapse when one delegation storms out.

answers.text: Privately appeal to both parties’ mutual interests and propose informal dialogue in a neutral setting.
answers.details: Uses tact and empathy to re-establish communication channels.

answers.text: Publicly reprimand the delegation that walked out to demonstrate firmness.
answers.details: Projects authority but risks entrenching hostility.

answers.text: Terminate the conference and submit a negative report to Starfleet Command.
answers.details: Ends any chance of reconciliation and wastes invested effort.

exam.summary: You discover that one party in ongoing trade talks is using a covert surveillance device.

answers.text: Pause negotiations, confront the offending party privately, and offer a path to resume with transparency.
answers.details: Protects integrity while allowing de-escalation and recovery of trust.

answers.text: Expose the deception publicly before all delegates.
answers.details: Satisfying but humiliates the offender, potentially collapsing the talks.

answers.text: Pretend ignorance and use the device to feed disinformation.
answers.details: Tactical gain undermines ethical credibility central to Federation diplomacy.

exam.summary: Two worlds refuse to accept refugees displaced by a supernova.

answers.text: Negotiate a temporary shared-support plan with proportional aid commitments from each government.
answers.details: Embodies Federation cooperation while mitigating humanitarian crisis.

answers.text: Transport all refugees to the nearest Federation starbase without approval.
answers.details: Violates jurisdiction and risks diplomatic backlash.

answers.text: Appeal to both worlds’ sense of interdependence and mutual defense treaties.
answers.details: Persuasive and lawful though dependent on shared history of trust.

exam.summary: A neutral world asks for advanced replicator technology to combat famine.

answers.text: Offer humanitarian shipments but deny restricted technology transfer per Federation law.
answers.details: Balances compassion with legal adherence to the Prime Directive and trade accords.

answers.text: Provide the technology quietly under diplomatic secrecy.
answers.details: Illegal transfer invites sanctions and political scandal.

answers.text: Petition the Federation Council for an exemption based on urgent humanitarian need.
answers.details: Shows initiative and empathy while maintaining transparency.

exam.summary: Evidence emerges that a long-time ally is supplying weapons to a hostile power.

answers.text: Privately confront the ally’s leadership and present verified evidence before escalation.
answers.details: Preserves dignity and allows redemption before punitive action.

answers.text: Suspend all treaties and issue a public condemnation immediately.
answers.details: Displays decisive stance but eliminates diplomatic leverage.

answers.text: Ignore the intelligence until Starfleet orders intervention.
answers.details: Failure to act condones the betrayal and erodes trust across alliances.
